decision_conditions: It is recommended that these three trees which are situated to the right hand boundary of The Old Cottage in the rear garden, behind the barn on the boundary with Stock House, can have the following works completed.
Small holly (T1) fell, damaging neighbours fence.
Silver Birch (T2) Prune overhanging branches to Stock House, 30% reduction of overhanging branches
Cherry (T3) Prune, overall crown reduction of 30% to include cutting back the overhang to Stock House

It is suggested that you engage the services of a qualified and fully insured tree surgeon to carry out the above work on your behalf (you should ask to see the contractor's insurance certificate and make sure that it is up to date).
The applicant is advised that if you wish to carry out further works to the above trees you will need to obtain our further consent.

Having considered the particular circumstances of the case and the position of the tree for which consent to fell has been granted the Council has decided that it will not be necessary to replace the tree.

Please note that if the work for which consent is granted is not carried out within 2 years of the date of this letter, it will be necessary to submit a fresh application if it is intended to implement the work.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
Small holly (T1) fell damaging neighbours fence. No replacement
Silver Birch (T2) Prune overhanging branches to Stock House
Cherry (T3) Prune  overhanging branches and reduce spread
